snippet: Eight million dollars of the payment, resolving an inquiry into tainted peanut butter, is the largest criminal fine for a food-borne illness in the U.S....
abstract: ConAgra Grocery Products, subsidiary of Chicago-based packaged foods corporation, pleads guilty to misdemeanor count of shipping adulterated food in 2006 outbreak of salmonella traced back to Georgia plant that produced peanut butter; agrees to pay record fine of $11.2 million.
lead_paragraph: Eight million dollars of the payment, resolving an inquiry into tainted peanut butter, is the largest criminal fine for a food-borne illness in the U.S.

headline.main: ConAgra Agrees to Pay $11.2 Million in Salmonella Outbreak
headline.print_headline: ConAgra Will Pay Record Fine in Outbreak
